definition: to travel over land and water (idiom)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: I have to hunt over hill and dale to find something that's made in the USA these days.
sentences.chinese: 我现在得跋山涉水去找些美国制造的东西。

sentences.english: You head into the jungle with a GPS and what passes for a map, hiking up hills, down ravines, across rivers.
sentences.chinese: 带着GPS导航地图，走进丛林，跋山涉水。

sentences.english: After crossing over mountains and wading through rivers, Daniel and I have finally arrived at the beautiful Kanas Lake.
sentences.chinese: 我和大牛跋山涉水终于来到了美丽的喀纳斯湖。

definition: to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to climb mountains and wade rivers (idiom); fig. to make a long and difficult journey
make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
ten thousand crags and torrents (idiom); the trials and tribulations of a long journey/a long and difficult road
(adverbial phrase used with verbs such as 歸|归[gui1] or 赴[fu4] etc) traveling a great distance
to travel or work through night and day/to toil away for long hours
